title: Elon Musk’s Bitcoin Mantra error sparks social media buzz
description: In a recent online exchange with Twitter and Block co-founder Jack Dorsey, Elon Musk, the CEO of Tesla and SpaceX, made an inaccurate reference to a well-known cryptocurrency. The billionaire entrepreneur attempted to participate in a conversation about the importance of self-custody for crypto assets but misquoted the popular phrase, demonstrating a potential gap in ... title: Crypto provisions axed from 2023 US Defense bill
description: In recent legislative developments concerning cryptocurrency regulations in the United States, two crucial provisions addressing anti-money-laundering concerns were notably excluded from the joint version of the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA). The NDAA, a pivotal military funding bill, is traditionally considered a must-pass legislation that outlines the military budget for the upcoming year. Anti-money laundering ... Read more

title: Blast hits $823 million TVL amid bugs and controversies
description: Blast, a Web3 protocol, has rapidly amassed a total value locked (TVL) of $823 million within a few weeks since its controversial mid-November launch. DefiLlama’s data indicates a notable 26.5% gain over the past seven days, highlighting the protocol’s significant growth. It distinguishes itself through a unique business model, functioning as a scaling solution for ... Read more

title: Shiba Inu: Between Euphoria and Uncertainty
description: SHIB faces price fluctuations and token concentration, creating uncertainty and risk of massive market sell-offs. Puppynet’s Layer-1 migration to the Sepolia Network in Shibarium promises greater stability and optimal performance. SHIB reached a significant milestone by brushing the $0.00001 mark, which implied the elimination of a zero in its value. This psychological barrier, long awaited [...]

title: South African Regulator May Require Crypto Firms to have a Local Office
description:
The Financial Sector Conduct Authority (FCSA) of South Africa may soon reportedly mandate that cryptocurrency firms with overseas headquarters maintain a local office in the country.  This move by the regulator follows a Crypto Asset Market Study, which showed that a sizable number of Crypto firms operating in the country have their headquarters in foreign […]

The post South African Regulator May Require Crypto Firms to have a Local Office appeared first on Coin Edition.
